## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
# Read data from CSV files
data_list <- lapply(0:9, function(i) read.csv(paste0(i, "_data.csv")))

# Create a violin plot for "circum"
ggplot(data_list[[1]], aes(x = factor(1), y = circum)) +
  geom_violin() +
  labs(title = "Violin Plot for circum")

```
```{r}
# Read data from files into a list
file_paths <- list.files(pattern = "_data.csv", full.names = TRUE)
data_list <- lapply(file_paths, read.csv)
names(data_list) <- file_paths

# Function to calculate median and quantiles
calculate_summary_stats <- function(x) {
  median_val <- median(x)
  q25 <- quantile(x, 0.25)
  q75 <- quantile(x, 0.75)
  return(c(median = median_val, q25 = q25, q75 = q75))
}
# Set up a multiplot function
# Plot combined violin plots for each variable
circum_plots <- lapply(data_list, function(data) {
  ggplot(data, aes(x = 1, y = circum)) +
    geom_violin() +  ylim(c(0, 150))+
    labs(title = "")+theme_minimal() +
      theme(axis.title.x = element_blank(),  axis.title.y = element_blank(), # Remove x-axis label
        axis.text.x = element_blank())   # Remove x-axis ticks and text
})

num_size_plots <- lapply(data_list, function(data) {
  ggplot(data, aes(x = 1, y = num_size)) +
    geom_violin() + ylim(c(0, 0.4)) +
    labs(title = "")+theme_minimal() +
      theme(axis.title.x = element_blank(),  # Remove x-axis label
        axis.text.x = element_blank(),axis.title.y = element_blank())   # Remove x-axis ticks and text
})

circum_size_plots <- lapply(data_list, function(data) {
  ggplot(data, aes(x=1,  y = circum/num_size)) +
    geom_violin() + ylim(c(200, 1000)) +
    labs(title = "")+theme_minimal() +
      theme(axis.title.x = element_blank(),  # Remove x-axis label
        axis.text.x = element_blank(),axis.title.y = element_blank())   # Remove x-axis ticks and text
})

# Combine the plots for each variable into one figure
combined_circum <- multiplot(plotlist = circum_plots, cols = 10)
combined_num_size <- multiplot(plotlist = num_size_plots, cols = 10)
combined_circum_size <- multiplot(plotlist = circum_size_plots, cols = 10)

# Arrange the combined plots vertically
combined_plots <- multiplot(combined_circum, combined_num_size, combined_circum_size, cols = 1)
combined_plots

```
```{r}
# Read data from files into a list
file_paths <- list.files(pattern = "_data.csv", full.names = TRUE)
data_list <- lapply(file_paths, read.csv)
names(data_list) <- file_paths

# Function to calculate median and quantiles
calculate_summary_stats <- function(x) {
  median_val <- median(x)
  q25 <- quantile(x, 0.25)
  q75 <- quantile(x, 0.75)
  return(c(median = median_val, q25 = q25, q75 = q75))
}

# Set up a multiplot function
multiplot <- function(..., plotlist = NULL, file, cols = 1, layout = NULL) {
  require(grid)

  # Make a list from the ... arguments and plotlist
  plots <- c(list(...), plotlist)

  numPlots = length(plots)

  # If layout is NULL, then use 'cols' to determine layout
  if (is.null(layout)) {
    # Make the panel
    # ncol: Number of columns of plots
    layout <- matrix(seq(1, cols * ceiling(numPlots/cols)),
                     ncol = cols, nrow = ceiling(numPlots/cols))
  }

  if (numPlots == 1) {
    print(plots[[1]])

  } else {
    # Set up the page
    grid.newpage()
    pushViewport(viewport(layout = grid.layout(nrow(layout), ncol(layout))))

    # Make each plot, in the correct location
    for (i in 1:numPlots) {
      # Get the i,j matrix positions of the regions that contain this subplot
      matchidx <- as.data.frame(which(layout == i, arr.ind = TRUE))

      print(plots[[i]], vp = viewport(layout.pos.row = matchidx$row,
                                      layout.pos.col = matchidx$col))
    }
  }
}

# Combine the plots for each variable into one figure with quantile points and added color
combined_circum <- multiplot(
  plotlist = lapply(data_list, function(data) {
    ggplot(data, aes(x = 1, y = circum)) +
      geom_violin(fill = "skyblue", color = "darkblue") +
      geom_point(aes(x = 1, y = median(circum)), color = "red", size = 2) +
      geom_point(aes(x = 1, y = quantile(circum, 0.25)), color = "darkblue", size = 2) +
      geom_point(aes(x = 1, y = quantile(circum, 0.75)), color = "darkblue", size = 2) +
      ylim(c(0, 150)) +
      labs(title = "") + theme_minimal() +
      theme(
        axis.title.x = element_blank(),
        axis.title.y = element_blank(),
        axis.text.x = element_blank()
      )
  }),
  cols = 10
)

combined_num_size <- multiplot(
  plotlist = lapply(data_list, function(data) {
    ggplot(data, aes(x = 1, y = num_size)) +
      geom_violin(fill = "lightcoral", color = "darkred") +
      geom_point(aes(x = 1, y = median(num_size)), color = "blue", size = 2) +
      geom_point(aes(x = 1, y = quantile(num_size, 0.25)), color = "orange", size = 2) +
      geom_point(aes(x = 1, y = quantile(num_size, 0.75)), color = "orange", size = 2) +
      ylim(c(0, 0.4)) +
      labs(title = "") + theme_minimal() +
      theme(
        axis.title.x = element_blank(),
        axis.title.y = element_blank(),
        axis.text.x = element_blank()
      )
  }),
  cols = 10
)

combined_circum_size <- multiplot(
  plotlist = lapply(data_list, function(data) {
    ggplot(data, aes(x = 1, y = circum / num_size)) +
      geom_violin(fill = "lightgreen", color = "darkgreen") +
      geom_point(aes(x = 1, y = median(circum / num_size)), color = "purple", size = 2) +
      geom_point(aes(x = 1, y = quantile(circum / num_size, 0.25)), color = "darkgreen", size = 2) +
      geom_point(aes(x = 1, y = quantile(circum / num_size, 0.75)), color = "darkgreen", size = 2) +
      ylim(c(200, 1000)) +
      labs(title = "") + theme_minimal() +
      theme(
        axis.title.x = element_blank(),
        axis.title.y = element_blank(),
        axis.text.x = element_blank()
      )
  }),
  cols = 10
)

# Arrange the combined plots vertically
combined_plots <- multiplot(
  combined_circum,
  combined_num_size,
  combined_circum_size,
  cols = 1
)

combined_plots

```
```{r}

#resample from circum_9
circum_9 <- read.csv("9_data.csv")$circum

#resample from size_9
size_9 <- read.csv("9_data.csv")$num_size

#resample from ratio_9
ratio_9 <- circum_9/size_9

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r}
# Function to perform KS test with resampling
ks_test_resampling <- function(data, variable, n_resamples = 10000) {
  observed_statistic <- ks.test(data, "pnorm")$statistic
  
  resample_statistics <- replicate(n_resamples, {
    sampled_data <- sample(data, replace = TRUE)
    ks.test(sampled_data, "pnorm")$statistic
  })
  
  p_value <- mean(resample_statistics >= observed_statistic)
  
  return(list(
    observed_statistic = observed_statistic,
    resample_statistics = resample_statistics,
    p_value = p_value
  ))
}

# Perform KS test with resampling on circum_9
ks_result <- ks_test_resampling(circum_9, "circum_9")
ks_result <- ks_test_resampling(size_9, "circum_9")
ks_result <- ks_test_resampling(ratio_9, "circum_9")


```

```{r}
library(boot)

# Define the function for the Kolmogorov-Smirnov test
ks_test <- function(data, indices) {
  # Extract the data based on the indices
  sampled_data <- data[indices]
  
  # Perform the KS test on the sampled data
  ks.test(sampled_data, "pnorm")$statistic
}


# Set the number of bootstrap samples
num_samples <- 100

bootstrap_results <- boot(circum_9, ks_test, R = num_samples)
bootstrap_results


hist(bootstrap_results$t, main = "Distribution of KS Statistic", xlab = "KS Statistic")



bootstrap_results <- boot(size_9, ks_test, R = num_samples)
bootstrap_results


hist(bootstrap_results$t, main = "Distribution of KS Statistic", xlab = "KS Statistic")



bootstrap_results <- boot(ratio_9, ks_test, R = num_samples)
bootstrap_results


hist(bootstrap_results$t, main = "Distribution of KS Statistic", xlab = "KS Statistic")
library(e1071)
skewness(circum_9)
skewness(size_9)
skewness(ratio_9)

```
